title: Notarius armbrusteri
text:
Notarius armbrusteri is a <a href="species">species</a> of <a href="catfish">catfish</a> in the family <a href="Ariidae">Ariidae</a>. It was described by <a href="Ricardo%20Betancur-Rodr%C3%ADguez">Ricardo Betancur-Rodríguez</a> and <a href="Arturo%20Acero%20Pizarro">Arturo Acero Pizarro</a> in 2006. It inhabits <a href="marine%20habitats">marine</a> waters around <a href="Buenaventura%2C%20Valle%20del%20Cauca">Buenaventura, Valle del Cauca</a>, in <a href="Colombia">Colombia</a>. Males reach a maximum <a href="standard%20length">standard length</a> of , while females reach a maximum SL of .
The <a href="Specific%20name%20%28zoology%29">species epithet</a> "armbrusteri" was given in honour of <a href="Jonathan%20W.%20Armbruster">Jonathan W. Armbruster</a>, a curator at the <a href="Auburn%20University">Auburn University</a> Museum, whom the authors credited with providing important contributions to the taxonomy of catfish in neotropical regions.
